column1: As our school system adapts to the rise in COVID-19 cases I will continue to keep a close eye on any changes to school openings and closures in district. For the time being this is what we know: https://t.co/xlK17p61YI

Especially with more families going hungry due to the COVID-19 pandemic America can’t afford delays in its food assistance programs. We need @USDA to answer to concerns that the Farmers to Families Food Box program isn’t reaching New Yorkers most in need. https://t.co/t6x8Faj2g6

This peaceful transition of power is not only vital to our democracy but to our #COVID19 response. A smooth transfer of power will allow the administration to swiftly address the pandemic and leave no American waiting for the national response. https://t.co/jEjDlu0aTw

As the pandemic progresses inmates and staff at NY prisons face an exceptionally high rate of #COVID19 spread. Incarcerated or otherwise no one should be forced into close proximity during a pandemic. We need a process of compassionate release. https://t.co/mjA70AQ4o7

Mnuchin claims programs for emergency #COVID19  economic support are no longer needed stripping away the Federal Reserve’s funds to continue them.   This pandemic is still an active threat to our economy. This is callous and cruel to the highest degree. https://t.co/GLUNkcK62S

Ann & business owners like her are struggling to replace revenue they lost this past year due to COVID-19. Congress must come together and enact additional relief for hurting Americans.(2/2) https://t.co/PoH9Bbi6e5
My statement on the recent diagnoses of #COVID19 among Members of Congress. I wish every American currently afflicted a swift and healthy recovery. https://t.co/3IW27sgsLU
The current closure of NYC public schools due to #COVID testing rates has no set end date and will likely continue through Thanksgiving break. Be sure to plan accordingly. https://t.co/2H4VNjt3b1
Attention parents: Starting tomorrow Thursday November 19 all public schools in the city will be closed due to rising #COVID19 rates. https://t.co/Fuadew6wC6

Throughout the year military families across the country and the globe make hard sacrifices.     Throughout the #COVID19 pandemic these sacrifices have been harder.     But know this: these sacrifices have not gone – nor will they not go – unnoticed.     #MilitaryFamilyMonth
Attention NYC parents: 23 schools that were in #COVID red zones will be able to open this Thursday. For more information on openings check the link below: https://t.co/RSRaAZyC65
As this pandemic progresses into the winter we need to ensure that everyone can receive #COVID19 care. Your income should not determine whether you are worthy of treatment. https://t.co/VdjLxnPz6S

As NYers prepare to spend more time indoors this winter I joined @SenGillibrand to send a letter to NYCHA on its plans to prevent #COVID19 spread in public housing. Crushing this virus will require NYCHA to respond to the challenges that arise. https://t.co/HsKFClI5DI

A new report from @COVIDOversight shows the Trump Admin’s #FailureToLead on #COVID19 is among the worst failures of leadership in American history.  House Dems will continue to fight to protect public health honor our heroes & put $ in the pockets of Americans.  #ForThePeople
Unsure of your testing options in NYC for #COVID19? See the below link for resources and guides to help you find your local testing site. https://t.co/NagYGDSy8C

My office has already begun to investigate this situation and rest assured I will be getting to the bottom of this and making sure conditions are improved. During this time of COVID-19 housing has never been more important.

#Covid19 has made it clearer than ever that everyone needs reliable high-speed broadband. Today the #TrumpFCC doubled down on repealing #NetNeutrality. RT if you agree that internet access should be a right not a privilege. https://t.co/KyppMAEBq4

Our frontline medical workers are the backbone of our #COVID19 response. I am deeply concerned for the wellbeing of these EMTs and hope they have a speedy recovery. Meanwhile I will continue to push for PPE for everyone serving on the front line. https://t.co/Jm5pQEw06V

During the pandemic COVID can spread like wildfire. With this closure I am thankful that inmates will no longer be subject to these conditions. All inmates deserve ethical treatment full stop. https://t.co/GHWbeScFS5

If you’re a veteran you can expect substantial relief for veteran’s nursing homes and faster claims processing. The House has passed this: now the Senate must act. No matter what this admin tries we will push for your COVID relief. https://t.co/0BtYkNhEhU

Wearing a mask is key to staying safe and stopping the spread especially in the city’s hotspots.  My sincerest thanks to COVID-free Queens for your work in distributing masks to all New Yorkers. https://t.co/utSzKtuLEr

Unemployment Benefits Food Assistance Rent Relief  Small Business Aid  Education Funding  COVID Testing  That is what Trump is walking away from by saying he no longer wants to make a deal. He's abandoning the American people at a time of unprecedented need. https://t.co/5v1qR18Frd

New Yorkers please be aware of the current surge in cases taking place and take precautions. Remember to wear a mask when you’re going outside and maintain safe social distance.  https://t.co/PqDvCT3m7W https://t.co/m41wDxRh4a

As we see an increase in #COVID19 cases in neighborhoods across the City make sure you #WearAMask practice social distancing and follow local orders to protect yourself & your neighbors.  Pandemic safety is a team effort. And we are in this together.   https://t.co/yKDozVPOEa

Another example of how Republicans have failed the American people? The deficit is projected to grow to $3.3 trillion this year because of Republicans’ mismanagement of the COVID-19 pandemic. Our workers and our economy deserve better. #FailThePeople https://t.co/GtzsD7AzwM

Since the start @realdonaldtrump has downplayed the dangers of #COVID19 ignored & muzzled scientists and played politics with public health. This is the latest example of his Administration's deadly failures which have cost nearly 200000 American lives: https://t.co/Rw9V2x7URs

So proud to participate in this community mural painting at Woodhull which focuses on community and healing. All the more important as our city continues to recover from the height of the #COVID19 pandemic. Thank you for having me! https://t.co/VzvxpcckBJ

1/2 So many taxi workers were suffering from unsustainable debt prior to COVID-19 and the pandemic has pushed many over the brink. I'll continue supporting their efforts for debt relief. https://t.co/bAGHXQAXen
The first step to staying safe is easy accessible testing. Here’s how you can get tested for #COVID19 in NYC.  https://t.co/89LdRSQk5m

If we want to combat a potential second wave of #COVID19 we need to ensure our front lines are prepared. Essential medical workers need fully funded hospitals and added protections full stop. https://t.co/qXejee3GdL

How many lives could have been saved if Trump had actually been honest about the danger posed by the coronavirus? It’s time for the Republican Senate to do the right thing put #FamiliesFirst and pass the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/Xx6IUPNqZ2

Today marks the beginning of Hispanic Heritage Month. This month we honor Latino and Hispanic Americans’ contributions to our nation. Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic Latinos are proving themselves more essential than ever and resilient in the face of adversity. #HHM https://t.co/4u814vKxBg

Last week I pressed @stevenmnuchin1 on @realdonaldtrump's inadequate rental relief Exec Order.   He conceded the Administration would prefer *legislation* providing help to renters.   So - why did @senatemajldr completely omit it from the GOP's #COVID19 bill?   Another failure. https://t.co/K3OmMZLbOj

New York: we’ve come a long way since the spring but the fight against #COVID19 is far from over.   Make sure you’re practicing social distancing and other necessary precautions as we continue to lower our state’s numbers.  https://t.co/WKhqVp1sXq

Today I joined with @SenSchumer and colleagues to oppose the Senate GOP’s wholly inadequate #COVID19 bill. New Yorkers and the American people want real relief like in the #HeroesAct - not political posturing https://t.co/dgBny3RHkW
I will continue to fight alongside my fellow @housedemocrats for $300 billion for public schools in the next #COVID19 relief bill. (2/2)  https://t.co/L0OBL3NEgB

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/wviqR8qcyG

The Administration’s failure to address the public health crisis has worsened and prolonged the economic crisis. Tuesday Sep. 1 at 1pm ET @COVIDOversight will hear from @USTreasury Secretary @stevenmnuchin1 on the serious challenges facing our economy: https://t.co/ADgv6CQggA

As of today Puerto Rico has 383 #COVID19 hospitalizations. I will continue fighting to ensure the Island has the help it needs in this public health emergency.   Puerto Rico cannot be left behind in our fight against coronavirus!  https://t.co/pkghc0Awlr

While new diagnoses are on the decline we’re not out of the woods yet.  The more we continue to social distance and wear masks the sooner we can return to the places and activities we love. #wearamask https://t.co/xA3JcEYNTW
It makes me so proud of my community when I see NYers come together to make a difference. Thank you to @NYCHealthHeroes for your contribution to the fight against COVID-19! https://t.co/ZF1xfoBtDX

.@realDonaldTrump officially designated teachers as “essential workers” without providing any of the safety precautions they need to create a healthy #COVID19 free classroom. These teachers must work even after exposure to the virus so long as they are asymptomatic. (1/2)

#COVID19 has heightened and exposed disparities throughout our city. We should not exacerbate these problems. The city must take every possible step to ensure no communities are left behind and all schools can reopen safely together.   https://t.co/VtAKBfUe1Z
Attention Sunset Park residents: please get tested for #COVID19.   CURB is doing free pickups to Brooklyn Army Terminal from 9am – 7pm.   For more information call 347-752-4244.

Today I'm in Sunset Park to say #DontMessWithUSPS. We can't let @realDonaldTrump gut our postal service for his own agenda. Veterans rely on USPS for medicine delivery. Small businesses need USPS for basic commerce. Americans are relying on USPS to vote safely during #COVID19. https://t.co/9HBC8CjawW

When small businesses call for help we answer. I’ve authored legislation that would protect enterprising businesses from predatory loaning practices as they weather the financial hardships of #COVID19. https://t.co/oWp5TvGrU3

Not only is @realDonaldTrump's assault on the USPS an attack on our democracy but it also threatens our nation's #Smallbiz who are already reeling from the #COVID19 pandemic. Our economy needs an effective postal service and I'll be fighting to end this slowdown. https://t.co/meGiAZCpTW

Immigrant communities continue to bear the brunt of #COVID19’s economic fallout. NY we never leave our neighbors behind. Let’s fight to secure the resources hard-hit communities need to weather this storm – together. https://t.co/o7cG6cjnvo

There is no racial justice without economic justice. When Black women are paid less than their white counterparts they have less money to put away in savings making it even harder to weather unexpected financial storms like the #COVID19 pandemic. #BlackWomensEqualPay https://t.co/sB5H11cqeL

Since the Families First Coronavirus Response Act was signed into law companies must provide two weeks of paid sick leave to anyone unable to work due to #COVID19 but exempts front-line healthcare providers and companies with 500+ employees. (1/2)  https://t.co/rLizb0umVX

5/5 Es importante que sepas que si das positivo al COVID hay recursos disponibles para ayudarte a guardar la cuarentena de forma segura—incluyendo comida  y cualquier otro apoyo que necesites. No dejes de hacerte la prueba y regar la voz.

*HILO IMPORTANTE PARA SUNSET PARK* Favor de leer y RT  Hemos visto un aumento en casos de #COVID19 en #SunsetPark y alrededores. Por favor háganse la prueba.   Nuevo centro de pruebas en la esquina de 44 y la 6ta Avenida 10am-4pm Desde hoy hasta Viernes 8/15 & del 8/17-821  1/5

* IMPORTANT THREAD FOR SUNSET PARK *  PLEASE READ & RETWEET   1/5 We are seeing an increase in #COVID19 cases in #SunsetPark. Neighbors please get tested!   New testing site at corner of 44th St. & 6th Ave.   10 a.m. - 4 p.m. Today – Friday 8/15 & Next Mon.-Fri. (8/17 – 21)

A new report from @MaketheroadNY makes it abundantly clear how immigrant and minority communities were left behind in #COVID19 aid including rent and employment support.   We must do more to fight for these vulnerable communities.  Read more below:  https://t.co/rixfm0n6PB

Women make up 52% of essential workers during the #COVID19 pandemic.  And Women of Color - including Latinas - are the most likely to work in low-wage jobs where they are being shortchanged by a combined gender and racial wage gap.  We need #HealthEquity for Women of Color. https://t.co/wF9Zw46D4b

President Trump wants Americans to think his weak executive actions will turn the tide of the fight against COVID19. ➡️5 million cases. ➡️160000 dead. ➡️55 million first-time unemployment claims. Enough of Trump’s #FailureToLead.   GOP need to negotiate with Democrats now!

#Coronavirus trends are heading in the wrong direction yet some “red zone” governors refuse to adopt simple science-based measures to protect their residents. We need a #NationalStrategy with aggressive mitigation efforts to change this deadly trajectory & contain the virus.
